definitions: the exertion of a modifying or controlling influence on something

examples.text: endorphins in the body are responsible for the modulation of pain sensation

shortDefinitions: exertion of modifying or controlling influence on something

definitions: variation in the strength, tone, or pitch of one's voice
shortDefinitions: variation in strength, tone, or pitch of one's voice

definitions: alteration of the amplitude or frequency of an electromagnetic wave or other oscillation in accordance with the variations of a second signal

examples.text: modulation of the ray amplitude will result in sound being heard
researchers observed the modulation of electrical conductance

shortDefinitions: alteration of amplitude or frequency of electromagnetic wave in accordance with variations of second signal

definitions: a change from one key to another in a piece of music

examples.text: their bold approach to harmony and modulation
there is a beautiful modulation from B flat to G major

shortDefinitions: change from one key to another in piece of music

definitions: the process of changing from one form or condition into another

examples.text: the modulation from an oral to a written technology in ancient Greek civilization

shortDefinitions: process of changing from one form or condition to another
